dublin_core.dcvalue: A large number of environmental and lifestyle factors may negatively affect spermatogenesis and male fertility This article enumerates the current state of knowledge regarding those that have been identified and extrapolates the predicted magnitude of these effects over the next 20 years based on current societal trends However it is likely that additional factors have yet to be recognized Additional research is needed to further define and clarify environmental factors that affect male fertility in order to mitigate their effects
The Urologic clinics of North America
Lifestyle, environment, and male reproductive health.
